HOLY SHIT THE ATMOSPHERE. In my opinion Portal 1 is not as good a game as Portal 2 is. But damn does it have atmosphere. I know the internet went on about the companion cube for YEARS. But there is no way to truly apreciate that level without experiencing it. The incoherent scribbling on the wall, the cold sterelized atmosphere, GLaDos' robotic voice heckling you through the speaker all makes for an amazingly dark and lonely atmosphere.

La mec√°nica de los portales es bastante interesante y da una inmensidad de posibilidades para Puzzles, uno de mis juegos favoritos, aunque no se puede ver mucha historia, lo que se muestra es lo suficientemente intrigante para jugar la segunda entrega.
Juego obligatorio si quieres jugar Portal 2.

Despite Portal being made in 2007 it really looked like it was made in 2012.
The graphics are really good considering it was made in 2007. Valve never fails to amaze us.
The game has a pretty good story and the most important of all: [b] DO NOT BUY PORTAL 2 BEFORE PORTAL 1! [/b]
Defeating GLaDOS really felt like victory but at the same time you feel your soul crying inside.
I finished this game in a day and I really loved it to the point that I felt that my heart was fulfilled inside because of how beautiful this game is, Once again, Valve never fails to amaze us.

A progenitor to  modern puzzle environment games.

i got this a few years ago and made back those measly 10 bucks a LONG time ago, but dont buy it. its great for speedrunning but other than that the game is too short and you don even get to use the orange portal until more than halfway. more game time gets used with the blue portal gun with orange automatically placed than there are actual orange portal gun puzzles. and also its way dated and by the time it feels like its getting somewhere it abruptly stops and the games over. the game itself is ok but can be beaten in around 3 hours and feels no more than an overpriced tech demo that lives in the shadow of its really amazing sequel, portal 2. if you have 10 bucks to spare PLEASE go buy portal 2 or half life 2. they are both absolutely phenomenal games.
Awesome idea and puzzles are just challenging enough to feel rewarding when you solve them without being so hard that you get stuck

Portal 2 is a brain puzzle, while Portal 1 is an intense evaluation of portal mechanics. The story is decent, but the game shines when you find yourself shooting portals through the air and pulling off some absolutely ludicrous moves, using the laws of physics at your utter disposal.

7/10
